Name: Harold Thompson

Residence: Lives in a single-family home in a rural area near Cheyenne, Wyoming, with his wife Susan

Income: Combined household income of $55,000 per year, consisting of his military pension, Social Security benefits, and Susan's part-time job as a librarian

Economic Concerns: As a retired couple, Harold and Susan are concerned about the rising cost of healthcare and prescription medications, as well as the potential impact of inflation on their fixed income. They are also worried about the decline of rural services and the increasing difficulty in accessing quality healthcare in their area.

Family Structure: Harold and Susan have two adult children, both of whom have moved out of state for work. They have four grandchildren, whom they see regularly.

Health Status: Harold has hypertension and arthritis, which he manages with medication and regular doctor's visits. Susan has diabetes and requires regular check-ups.

Community Involvement: Harold is an active member of the local VFW post and participates in community events, such as parades and charity fundraisers.

This persona is designed to capture the characteristics of a retired, white, male veteran living in rural Wyoming, with a focus on his economic concerns, family structure, and community involvement.
